intro: Cleome chilensis, commonly known as the "Mexican spider flower," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is an annual herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that resemble spider legs, hence its common name. Cleome chilensis is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and easy care requirements.
